content: fluffy waves socks kaidi rand @rannapiigaknits fluffy waves socks bring a touch of seaside calm to your needles with soft fibers playful ruffles and endless color possibilities this design is both cozy and fun perfect for using up leftovers and creating a pair as unique as you are suitable for both beginners and experienced knitters the pattern invites you to explore color and texture play in your own way pattern description light cozy socks with playful wave-inspired ruffled cuffs perfect for adding a touch of seaside charm to your knitting the socks are knitted toe up in the round with a diamond heel for a comfortable fit about the pattern fluffy waves socks were inspired by the gentle rhythm of the sea meeting the shore on a calm day the soft color changes flow like ripples in shallow water while the ruffled cuff adds a playful splash of seafoam at your ankles light cozy and just a little whimsical these socks are perfect for bringing a touch of sea breeze to your everyday knitting whether you re walking along a sandy beach or simply dreaming of the coast fluffy waves will keep your feet wrapped in seaside charm © kaidi rand @rannapiigaknits | personal use only | v 3 2 1 #fluffywavessocks skills required starting socks toe up knitting in the round basic increases and decreases picking up stitches strechy bind off yarn you need fingering weight sock yarn approximately 70-100 g in total depending on the size and the length of the sock any solid tonal variegated self-striping or self- patterning yarn will work you may choose two or more colors if helical knitting is desired to use up leftover yarn also you need some lace weight mohair for ruffles 10g in total should be enough example i used nako boho self-patterning and drops fabel as a cc for striping from half way up the heel to the leg and for cuffs ruffles are made with rosários aurora and schachenmayr alpaca cloud needles & notions 2 25 mm us 1 circular needles or dpns adjust size to get gauge the pattern is written for the magic loop technique the pattern can be easily adapted to your preferred knitting method stitch markers tapestry needle scissors © kaidi rand @rannapiigaknits
